story.title: The Christmas Sweater - Episode 4
story.storyDescription: Ever since her motherâ€™s death, Noelle hasnâ€™t wanted to go home for the holidays. But perhaps a bit of holiday magic is all she needsâ€¦
story.creator: web-uploader
story.prePaywallNotification: Noelle is shocked by Dadâ€™s big news. Find out what she says next in THE CHRISTMAS SWEATER.

messages.text: Once Noelle picks her jaw off the floor, she lets out a hoarse whisper.
I think I need to go up to my room.
She keeps her steps measured as she moves toward the staircase, but when she reaches itâ€¦
She starts sprinting.
Managing to keep her cool for just a moment, she shuts her bedroom door quietly.
But then she throws herself down on her canopy bed from childhood.
She covers her head with a pillow, blood pounding in her ears.
About a half hour later, she hears her bedroom door creak open.
Noelle?
Noelle picks up her head.
I donâ€™t know if I can handle all of this.
Noelle, I donâ€™t mean to be a jerk, butâ€¦
You donâ€™t really have a choice.
Dad loves Beatrice. She makes him really happy.
And since you love Dad, you have to try and be happy for him too.
But it hurts. Doesnâ€™t it feel like weâ€™re doing something behind Momâ€™s back?
Mom would have wanted Dad to be happy.
How can you know what sheâ€™d want?
Becauseâ€¦Iâ€¦
What?
I canâ€™t tell you.
Beatrice should be the one to tell that story.
You should talk to her.
I donâ€™t want to even look at that woman.
Well that woman is about to become part of our family.
What are you going to do, ignore the family once Dad gets remarried?
Maria looks down, and her face goes red as she speaks softlyâ€¦
Almost under her breath.
It wouldnâ€™t be the first time you ignored us when times got hardâ€¦
Noelle feels that familiar pang of regret slice through her body.
When did she become such a cold person?
I didnâ€™t thinkâ€”
Sometimes it doesnâ€™t seem like you do.
Maria shakes her head quickly.
It clears away the tears that are threatening to spill over her eyelids.
Anywayâ€¦
No.
Noelle puts her hand on top of Mariaâ€™s.
As the big sister, Noelleâ€™s hands were always larger than Mariaâ€™s.
But by the time they reached adulthood, Mariaâ€™s hands stayed smaller still.
Petite and nimble â€” theyâ€™re the hands of a surgeon.
You donâ€™t have to brush this off, Maria.
I hurt you when I moved. And Iâ€™m really sorry.
I was so wrapped up in my own grief over Momâ€™s deathâ€¦
That I didnâ€™t stop to understand your pain too.
Thanks for apologizing.
I â€” I know you didnâ€™t mean to ignore usâ€¦
Youâ€™re just like Mom was, Noelle. Youâ€™re a feeler.
You let your emotions course through your bodyâ€”
I do not!
Let me finish.
All that changed when Mom died.
It was like you stopped feeling. Suddenly you justâ€¦
Shut down.
You moved away to Florida to your hotshot lawyer jobâ€¦
And became thisâ€¦shell of a person.
I know we still text and stuffâ€¦but itâ€™s not the same.
I feel like Iâ€™ve lost my sister.
Mariaâ€¦I had no idea you felt that way.
I think deep down you feel it too.
We used to be so closeâ€¦
Yeah. I miss that.
I miss it too. It was hard enough losing Mom, Noelle.
I donâ€™t want to lose you.
You wonâ€™t. I promise to be better.
Just â€” Noelle?
Noelle and her sister look at each other. Without another wordâ€¦
They wrap each other in a bear hug.
The pressure of the embrace feels so goodâ€”
Like a long-lost friend Noelle hasnâ€™t visited in a while.
When they break the hug, Maria clears her throat.
I have something to apologize for too.
Iâ€™m sorry I was too nervous to tell you about the guy Iâ€™ve been seeing for a yearâ€¦
For a YEAR?!
Haha, yes!
Oh my god! Does that mean itâ€™s serious?
Maria starts fiddling with Noelleâ€™s comforter.
Oh my god! Itâ€™s TOTALLY serious.
Maria nods furtively.
But donâ€™t tell Dad, ok?
I donâ€™t want to jinx anything.
Wow, Iâ€¦
Are you mad?
Mad? Why would I be?
Because I saw your face downstairs when you met Tom.
And I know you always wanted to get married first.
Oh, Maria, I should have never made you feel that way.
Iâ€™mâ€¦happy for you.
And as soon as Noelle says the words, the feeling blossoms in her chest.
A smile spreads across her lips.
Maybe there is a chance for Noelle to feel joy this Christmas after all.
She grins.
Iâ€™m really, really happy for you, Peapod.
Hey! I thought we agreed to stop calling me that.
Nah, youâ€™ll always be Peapod to me.
Haha, at this point, Iâ€™m actually okay with you calling me that name.
It reminds me of old times. Andâ€¦oh!
What?
Maria gets up and pulls a garment bag out of the closet.
I almost forgot. I have something for you.
Hey! I thought we had a rule â€” no presents â€˜til Christmas!
This isnâ€™t really a present, itâ€™sâ€¦an heirloom.
From Mom?
Mariaâ€™s face reddens.
Just open it.
Noelle tears off the opaque plastic wrap and finds the most luxurious sweater sheâ€™s ever seen.
Itâ€™s deep red, with a chic asymmetric fold-over collar that drapes over the left shoulder.
And the body is stitched with chunky vertical cables with fine golden threads running in between.
Noelle strokes the soft fabric.
Is thisâ€¦?
Homemade alpaca wool.
Oh my god, itâ€™s so soft.
Try it on.
Noelle pulls off the sweater sheâ€™s wearing and slips this new one over her tank top.
Wowâ€¦
No kidding. It looks like that sweater was MADE for you.
Itâ€™s magical too.
Noelle lifts an eyebrow, sending Maria into a fit of laughter.
I donâ€™t mean that it can cast spells and stuff! Itâ€™s justâ€¦
I was wearing it when I met Tom.
So I like to think it has a bit of magic in it.
Christmas magic.
Noelle smiles, looking in the mirror one more time.
You know what?
I think you might be right.
Because for the first time this Christmas, Iâ€™m starting to feel the holiday spirit.
And I think Iâ€™m finally ready to let Beatrice tell me her side of the story.
